Sentencas: A typical failure mode of the anode-supported solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) is the cracking of electrolyte due to the excessive tensile stress caused by the expansion of anode during re-oxidation.
Titulo: Effect of inhomogeneous oxidation on the mechanical degradation of anode supported solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: This paper builds a three-dimensional model based on the finite element method (FEM) to investigate the effect of inhomogeneous oxidation on mechanical degradation of SOFC.
Titulo: Effect of inhomogeneous oxidation on the mechanical degradation of anode supported solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The stress distributions and critical oxidation strains with considering inhomogeneous oxidation are compared to those of supposed homogeneous oxidation.
Titulo: Effect of inhomogeneous oxidation on the mechanical degradation of anode supported solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The results indicate that the gradient of oxidation strain induces a large stress gradient and bending moment in anode, which increase the stresses and curvature of the cell, leading to the deterioration of SOFC degradation.
Titulo: Effect of inhomogeneous oxidation on the mechanical degradation of anode supported solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The critical oxidation strains are increased in the SOFC with considering the inhomogeneous oxidation except for the anode.
Titulo: Effect of inhomogeneous oxidation on the mechanical degradation of anode supported solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: By calculating the stress under homogeneous re-oxidation, the resistance to failure is underestimated for cathode, electrolyte and glass-ceramic (GC), but the resistance to failure of the anode is overestimated.
Titulo: Effect of inhomogeneous oxidation on the mechanical degradation of anode supported solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The effects of creep and thickness of the graded-oxidized zone on the redox stability are also investigated.
Titulo: Effect of inhomogeneous oxidation on the mechanical degradation of anode supported solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: This study helps to understand the effect of inhomogeneous oxidation and enhance the performance and lifetime of SOFC.
Titulo: Effect of inhomogeneous oxidation on the mechanical degradation of anode supported solid oxide fuel cell
